page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Radical changes in pattern due to the smaller farms disappearing and loss of farmland to housing estates.There are eight farms on the map King's Hill, Hill, Home,Oak, Rock,Stoneleigh Grange The Leasowes, and Manor Fields.The first three are no longer farms and are now private dwellings.Home farm is an exclusive Mews type group of houses The land belonging to the first two farms both of which were worked as tenancies are now farmed directly by the landowners Gregory Hood of Stratford. Home farm land was used in the construction of Coventry airport.Farming is mostly cereals, sown grass, beef cattle and sheep.Rock farm is a dairy unit.Oak farm now farms land which after World War 1 was set up as smallholdings for returning servicemen.The scheme was not successful.
